adjectives.description: zephyrous (comparative more zephyrous, superlative most zephyrous)

entries.meaning: Like a zephyr; (of a wind) soft, gentle, refreshing.
examples: Hither no winds, but zephyrous breaths repair,
Soft, as the sighs of love sick virgins are!
It was March now, the mild March of an early spring. There came new days, zephyrous and sweet.

entries.meaning: (of a fabric, garment, etc.) Light, fine, soft.
examples: That there will be flying machines before very long seems more than likely, and what deliciously zephyrous and diaphanous costumes will not the milliners devise for airy recreations in the near future!
